topic: Remember when we broke the internet?
speaker: Julia Ferraioli; Amanda Casari
description: Exploring how a handful of key open source projects ended up breaking the internet with surprising reasons (and solutions). Plus a sing-along.

speaker: JT Perry
description: Effects of the pandemic from a healthcare CIO perspective, plus some unexpected consequences with long structural effects.

speaker: Andrew Todd
description: Starting and fundraising for conservation nonprofits as a second job - and making it sustainable.

topic: The Year Of No (And The Growth It Inspired)
speaker: Amara Graham
description: A talk about feelings and a mid-career journey of "saying no" as the change to take charge of your professional direction.

topic: Socially Acceptable Places To Live If You're In Tech
speaker: Joe Emison
description: A leader's journey to finding the perfect place to build a business - by considering needs of future employees.

speaker: Margaret Fero
description: Notes from 'Bone Rooms' and AI Ethics: any learning system using a static corpus is already outdated.

topic: Everything You Want Is On The Other Side Of … Admin Privileges
speaker: Ann Cerveny
description: Breaking into tech later in a career: define yourself by where you want to go, don't let gatekeepers block you out.

speaker: Corey Quinn
description: A from the heart talk listing Corey's major failures: normalizing talking about getting fired helps all of us.

topic: Mentorship, And Restarting Civilization From Scratch
speaker: Jeremy Meiss
description: All the important how-tos about mentoring (or being a mentee), and how important that relationship is for organizational knowledge.

speaker: Rachel Stephens
description: Kindness! Explore your feelings before being an asshole on the internet - or anywhere, really; if you are: apologize, duh.

speaker: Bryan Cantrill
description: Improving educational systems to better recognize childrens' mental and emotional abilities.
